author: Asjylyn Loder
title: Bond Investors Pour Into Short-Term Funds
text:
Investors are flocking to short-term bond funds at a record pace as yields have risen to their highest levels in a decade.
For the first time since the financial crisis, investors this year can earn 2% or more on low-risk debt that matures in a year or less. While it is a paltry payout compared with precrisis levels, it is a welcome reprieve after years of near-zero interest rates, which dragged down payments on money-market accounts or certificates of deposit and pushed savers to buy riskier bonds, or those with longer maturities,...
